section.title: Configure DNS Domain and NS Records
section.para: To configure the default DNS domain and Name Server records for the default pool, follow these steps.

step.para: Ensure that designate_config.yml file is present in the ~/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data/designate folder. If the file or folder is not present, create the folder and copy designate_config.yml file from one of the example input models (for example, ~/openstack/examples/entry-scale-kvm/data/designate/designate_config.yml).
Modify the dns_domain and/or ns_records entries in the designate_config.yml file.
step.screen: data: dns_domain: example.org. ns_records: hostname: ns1.example.org. priority: 1 hostname: ns2.example.org. priority: 2

step.para: Edit your input model's control_plane.yml file to include DESIGNATE-CONFIG-CP1 in configuration-data section.
step.screen: control-planes: - name: control-plane-1 region-name: region1 lifecycle-manager-target configuration-data: - DESIGNATE-CONFIG-CP1 - NEUTRON-CONFIG-CP1

step.para: Continue your cloud deployment by reviewing and committing your changes.
step.screen: $ git add ~/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data/designate/designate_config.yml $ git commit -m "Adding DNS Domain and NS Records"

note.para: In an entry-scale model (), you will have 3 ns_records since the DNS service runs on all three control planes.
In a mid-scale model () or dedicated metering, monitoring and logging model (), the above example would be correct since there are only two controller nodes.
